page.title: 10Stonegate C.E.Primary School
page.content:
Stonegate School was founded in 1842. The school was built and financed by the Courthope family.
The original building has been extended to provide suitable accommodation for children of primary school age.In 1985 a new playground is being constructed and plans are being prepared for further necessary modifications.
95 children aged from 5 to 11 years attend the school.They are organised into four classes.All aspects of the curriculum are taught,and the school strives to foster a happy,instructive environment for its pupils.The highlight of 1985 has been the residential visit to the Snowdonia National Park.
